description.narrative: BAP aims to strengthen the capacity of the Caucasus Business and Development Network (CBDN) to advocate for regional economic cooperation as a vehicle for peace and development in the Caucasus; and to analyze the significance of existing international political-economic frameworks vis-?-vis the conflicts in the South Caucasus.

Strengthened capacities of conflict affected business communities for analysis, policy development and advocacy. Concept for regulating trans-Ingur/i economic relations developed by a team of Georgian and Abkhaz experts and business actors. (Yr. 1: key principles, Yr. 2: draft framework, Yr. 3: final framework) Business communities are actively engaged in the process (mobilised) and support generated among political actors (national and international level) for regulating trans-Ingur/i economic relations (Yr. 3) Improved understanding of the impact of and inter-linkages between political-economic frameworks and the conflicts (i.e. DC FTA, WTO, BSEC) and forward looking economic development scenarios for conflict affected societies. (Yr.1-2) Conflict resolution mainstreamed in political-economic frameworks and policies in the South Caucasus. Voice of marginalised business communities strengthened and broader support for regional economic cooperation as a peacebuilding strategy generated among business communities and political actors across the region (Yr. 1-3)
